translated: and the associated thoughts arise with root-cause as condition.🔽A wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling,🔽and a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and an unwholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling,🔽

original: sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: and associated with wholesome thoughts.

original: Naakusalaṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naakusalaṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naakusalaṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nasukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: na akusalam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na akusalam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutta  dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na akusalam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na sukhāya vedanāya
translated: From a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling🔽there arises, by way of root condition, a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naakusalaṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na akusalam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutta
translated: From an unwholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling there arises, by way of root condition, an unwholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling. From an unwholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling🔽there arises, by way of root condition, a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling. From an unwholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling🔽there arises, by way of root condition, an indeterminate thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca naabyākato nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Naakusalaṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na abyākataḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā na akusalam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutta
translated: Dependent on a state that is unwholesome, there is a state that is unwholesome and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling.🔽Dependent on a state that is unwholesome and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling, there is a state that is unwholesome and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naabyākataṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naabyākataṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na abyākatam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na abyākatam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutta  dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is indeterminate, there is a state that is indeterminate and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling.🔽Dependent on a state that is indeterminate and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling, there is a state that is unwholesome and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling.

original: Naabyākataṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: na abyākatam na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya
translated: Dependent on a state that is indeterminate, there is a state that is wholesome and is related to neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome feeling.

original: sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naabyākataṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca naabyākato nasukhāya vedanāya

translated: A conditionally arisen, neutral, unwholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises together with a wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Naabyākataṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca naabyākato nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Naabyākataṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ

translated: A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and a neutral, unwholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arise together.🔽A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and a neutral, unwholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arise together.

translated: In the case of cause, there are twenty-nine; in the case of object, twenty-four; … in the case of nutriment, nine; … in the case of faculty, twenty-nine; … in the case of absorption, twenty-four; … in the case of path, twenty-four; … in the case of association, twenty-four; … in the case of dissociation, twenty-four; … in the case of presence, twenty-four; … in the case of absence, twenty-four; … in the case of disappearance, twenty-four; … in the case of non-disappearance, twenty-four; … in the case of root, twenty-four; … in the case of non-root, twenty-four; … in the case of condition, twenty-four; … in the case of non-condition, twenty-four; … in the case of decisive-support, twenty-four; … in the case of non-decisive-support, twenty-four; … in the case of proximity, twenty-four; … in the case of non-proximity, twenty-four; … in the case of contiguity, twenty-four; … in the case of non-contiguity, twenty-four; … in the case of association, twenty-four; … in the case of non-association, twenty-four; … in the case of absence, twenty-four; … in the case of presence, twenty-four; … in the case of past, twenty-four; … in the case of future, twenty-four; … in the case of present, twenty-four; … in the case of unarisen, twenty-four; … in the case of arisen, twenty-four; … in the case of the ceased, twenty-four; … in the case of the non-ceased, twenty-four; … in the case of the past, twenty-four; … in the case of the future, twenty-four; … in the case of the present, twenty-four; … in the case of the conditioned, twenty-four; … in the case of the unconditioned, twenty-four; … in the case of the seen, twenty-four; … in the case of the seen and the unconditioned, twenty-four;

original: Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutta  dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling by way of root condition. A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is related to an unwholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling by way of root condition.

original: Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nadukkhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca naabyākato nadukkhāya🔽vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya🔽sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca naakusalo
analyzed: na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya 🔽sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutta 🔽dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na abyākataḥ na dukkhāya 🔽vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya 🔽sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na akusalaḥ
translated: A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is related to an indeterminate thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling by way of root condition. A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and an indeterminate thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling by way of root condition. A wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a wholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and an unwholesome thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling by way of root condition.

original: nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: and to the phenomena associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Naakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: na akusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: From a unwholesome, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state, a unwholesome, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state arises as the root-cause condition. … five.

original: Naabyākataṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … cha.
analyzed: na abyākatam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā cha
translated: From an indeterminate, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state, an indeterminate, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state arises as the root-cause condition. … six.

original: Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca naabyākataṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca
analyzed: na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na abyākatam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca
translated: From a wholesome, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state and an indeterminate, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state,

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: a wholesome, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state arises as the root-cause condition. … five.

original: Naakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca naabyākataṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca
analyzed: na akusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na abyākatam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca
translated: From a unwholesome, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state and an indeterminate, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling state,

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.🔽Nakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca naakusalaṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca  na kusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na akusalam na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca  dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as condition there arises a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, by way of root cause condition … five.

original: … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇi
translated: With a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and a unwholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as conditions there arises a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, by way of root cause condition … three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekūnatiṁsa, ārammaṇe catuvīsa …pe… vipāke nava …pe… avigate ekūnatiṁsa. (Sabbattha vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā ekūnatisa ārammaṇe catuvīsa pe vipāke nava pe avigate ekūnatisa sabbattha vitthāretabba
translated: In the root cause section there are twenty-nine, in the object section there are twenty-four … In the result section there are nine … In the unprompted section there are twenty-nine. (All should be expanded.)

original: 11.1.3. Adukkhamasukhavedanāyasampayuttapada
analyzed: adukkham asukha vedanā ya sampayutta pada
translated: ... associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root cause

original: Nakusalaṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: na kusalam na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: With a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as condition there arises a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, by way of root cause condition … five.

original: Naakusalaṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.🔽Naabyākataṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … cha.
analyzed: na akusalam na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca  na abyākatam na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā cha
translated: With a non-wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as condition there arises a non-wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling through the relation of root-cause … five.🔽With an indeterminate thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as condition there arises an indeterminate thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling through the relation of root-cause … six.

original: Nakusalaṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca naabyākataṁ naadukkhamasukhāya🔽vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.🔽Naakusalaṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca naabyākataṁ naadukkhamasukhāya
analyzed: na kusalam na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na abyākatam na adukkham asukhāya  vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca  na akusalam na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na abyākatam na adukkham asukhāya
translated: With a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and an indeterminate thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as conditions there arises a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling through the relation of root-cause … five.

original: vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto
analyzed: vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: With a non-wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and an indeterminate thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as conditions there arises a non-wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling through the relation of root-cause … five.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: A profitable … an indeterminate … (five sets of five, i.e. 25, are obtained by substituting “profitable” for “unprofitable” in each of the five sets of five.)

original: Nakusalaṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca naakusalaṁ naadukkhamasukhāya🔽vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto
analyzed: na kusalam na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na akusalam na adukkham asukhāya  vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: A profitable thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and an unprofitable thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling. … three … (Abbreviated.)🔽In the case of root-cause condition there are twenty-nine,

analyzed: hetuyā ekūnatisa ārammaṇe catuvīsa pe vipāke nava pe avigate ekūnatisa sabbattha vitthāro
